page.title: 08LANDMARKS IN LANGRISH (1)
page.content: The Hampshire and Taunton Record Offices supply much of the history about this area. Other sources include two libraries at Petersfield and Winchester. There are many Tumuli in the area,and perhaps the most interesting is Bordean (Burial Valley), where the tumulus has an entrenchment around it. Entrenchments at Froxfield are Anglo-Saxon and thought to be the boundary between the West Saxons and the South Saxons. The 'Top Ten' landmarks in the area are as follows:- the Froxfield entrenchments, Bordean House, the church, the farmhouse at Manor Farm,several 18th century houses ,Langrish House, the Dovecote at Manor Farm, War Hill (where there was a skirmish during the Civil War), Park Farm (granted free of tithes(taxes)), and Limekiln Copse.
